content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.
  1. Choose the quadratic equation that represents each graph.
  • \(y=x^2+x\)
  • \(y=-x^2+2\)
  • \(y=x^2-x\)
  • \(y=x^2+3x\)

ANSWER: \(y=x^2+x\)

  • \(y=x^2+x\)
  • \(y=-x^2+2\)
  • \(y=x^2-x\)
  • \(y=x^2+3x\)

ANSWER: \(y=-x^2+2\)

  • \(y=x^2+x\)
  • \(y=-x^2+2\)
  • \(y=x^2-x\)
  • \(y=x^2+3x\)

ANSWER: \(y=x^2-x\)

  • \(y=x^2+x\)
  • \(y=-x^2+2\)
  • \(y=x^2-x\)
  • \(y=x^2+3x\)

ANSWER: \(y=x^2+3x\)

Without graphing the equations, answer questions 2–5 to complete the table.


Equation

\(x\)-intercepts

\(x\)-coordinate of vertex

\(y=x^2+12x\)

2a. _____

2b. _____

\(y=x^2-3x\)

3a. _____

3b. _____

\(y=-x^2+16x\)

4a. _____

4b. _____

\(y=-x^2-24x\)

5a. _____

5b. _____

  1. Find the \(x\)-intercepts and the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=x^2+12x\).
    1. What are the \(x\)-intercepts for the equation \(y=x^2+12x\)?
  • \((0,0),(-12,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (3,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (16,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (-24,0)\)

ANSWER: \((0,0),(-12,0)\)

    1. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=x^2+12x\)?

ANSWER: -6

  1. Find the \(x\)-intercepts and the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=x^2-3x\).
    1. What are the \(x\)-intercepts for the equation \(y=x^2-3x\)?
  • \((0,0),(-12,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (3,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (16,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (-24,0)\)

ANSWER: \((0,0), (3,0)\)

    1. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=x^2-3x\)?

ANSWER: 1.5

  1. Find the \(x\)-intercepts and the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=-x^2+16x\).
    1. What are the \(x\)-intercepts for the equation \(y=-x^2+16x\)?
  • \((0,0),(-12,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (3,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (16,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (-24,0)\)

ANSWER: \((0,0), (16,0)\)

    1. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=-x^2+16x\)?

ANSWER: 8

  1. Find the \(x\)-intercepts and the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=-x^2-24x\).
    1. What are the \(x\)-intercepts for the equation \(y=-x^2-24x\)?
  • \((0,0),(-12,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (3,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (16,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (-24,0)\)

ANSWER: \((0,0), (-24,0)\)

    1. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex for the equation \(y=-x^2-24x\)?

ANSWER: -12

  1. Here is a graph that represents \(y=x^2\).
    1. Describe what would happen to the graph if the original equation were changed to \(y=x^2-6x\).
  • The graph would move to the right and down.
  • The graph would move to the left and down.
  • The graph would move to the right and up.
  • The graph would move to the left and up.

ANSWER: The graph would move to the right and down.

    1. Predict the \(x\)-intercepts of the graph if the original equation were changed to \(y=x^2-6x\).
  • \((0,0),(6,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (0,6)\)
  • \((0,0), (-6,0)\)
  • \((0,0), (0,-6)\)

ANSWER: \((0,0),(6,0)\)

    1. In which quadrant is the vertex located if the original equation were changed to \(y=x^2-6x\)?
  • First
  • Second
  • Third
  • Fourth

ANSWER: Fourth

  1. Select two equations whose graph opens upward.
  • \(y=-x^2+9x\)
  • \(y=10x−5x^2\)
  • \(y=(2x−1)^2\)
  • \(y=(1−x)(2+x)\)
  • \(y=x^2−8x−7\)

ANSWERS: \(y=(2x−1)^2\), \(y=x^2−8x−7\)

  1. Technology required. Use the three graphs to answer questions a–c. Then, use graphing technology to check each equation.

Graph A

Graph B

Graph C

    1. Which graph represents the equation \(f(x)=x(x+7)\) or \(f(x)=x^2+7x\)? Then, use graphing technology to check your answer.
  • Graph A
  • Graph B
  • Graph C

ANSWER: Graph A

    1. Which graph represents the equation \(g(x)=(x+4)(x−4)\) or \(g(x)=x^2−16\)? Then, use graphing technology to check your answer.
  • Graph A
  • Graph B
  • Graph C

ANSWER: Graph B

    1. Which graph represents the equation \(h(x)=(x−3)(x+9)\) or \(h(x)=x^2+6x−27\)? Then, use graphing technology to check your answer.
  • Graph A
  • Graph B
  • Graph C

ANSWER: Graph C
